clean_content:
Definition / general

* Benign mesenchymal proliferation with vascular and fatty components ([Pathologica 2006;98:239](17175794))* Associated with Castleman lymphadenopathy, hyaline vascular variant ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 1986;110:853](3755897))

Sites

* Various nodal sites, including cervical, mediastinal and retroperitoneal lymph nodes* Occurs in nodal parenchyma or extracapsular soft tissue* Miscellaneous extranodal sites can be involved

Pathophysiology

* Rare disorder of unknown etiology* Pseudotumor; not a true neoplasm

Clinical features

* Innocuous and slow growing

Radiology images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesangiolipomatoushyperplasiathumbimg01.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3037210/figure/fig01/)

Mesenteric tumor with soft tissue parts

Case reports

* 16 year old boy with paraparesis caused by an angiolipomatous hamartoma with Proteus syndrome and scoliosis ([J Neurosurg 2005;103:282](16238085))* 60 year old man with a spindle cell sarcoma containing a focal angiolipomatous hamartoma component ([J Pathol 2002;197:264](12015752))* 70 year old man with angiolipomatous mesenchymal hamartoma (angiolipomatosis) of sigmoid mesocolon ([Int J Clin Exp Pathol 2011;4:210](21326818))* Giant lymph node hyperplasia in an angiolipomatous mediastinal mass ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 1986;110:853](3755897))* Vascular transformation of sinuses in bilateral cervical lymph nodes ([Head Neck 1999;21:366](10376758))

Gross description

* Unencapsulated single or multiple yellow and fatty nodules up to 15 cm* Tan nodules may represent accompanying hyaline vascular Castleman lymphadenopathy

Gross images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/lymphnodesangiolipomatoushyperplasiathumbimg02.jpg)](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3037210/figure/fig02/)

Large smooth surfaced mass

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Noncircumscribed intranodal or extranodal mass* Mature adipose tissue and haphazard thick walled muscular vessels of varying sizes* No thrombi within disorganized vascular channels* Lacks other mesenchymal tissue types, such as muscle* No necrosis, dense sclerosis, lipoblasts or marked cytologic atypia

Immunohistochemistry & special stains

* [Smooth muscle actin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html) and [desmin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdesmin.html) highlight muscular vessels

Differential diagnosis

* [Angiomyolipoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodesangiomyolipoma.html): contains myomatous component, common in kidney* [Lipofibromatosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuelipofibromatosis.html): pediatric soft tissue tumor with conspicuous fibrous component* [Liposarcoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuewdliposarcoma.html): malignant tumor with lipoblasts
